page.title: 02ECOLOGY
page.content: This area is on the fringe of Dartmoor National park.Shaptor rock is a granite out crop and a point of geographical interest.We got a good view of the fields from shaptor rock. You go past Hawkmoor Hospital.There is a twisty path going up with lots of brambles along it.It is a steep rock and is very high but there are other rocks higher on Dartmoor. We saw some deciduous tree's such as silver birch and oak. Most of the fields around are rough grazing.Part of the woods is owned by the Woodland Trust.On top of Shaptor Rock there are some gorse bushes. There is also some heather. Here in Bovey Tracey the weather is quite mild but in the winter it is very cold and snowy because we are near to the moor's.It often snows in Hennock.
